messages: a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:05): DrDT: you got an SR9 handy?
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:06): although I'm looking for some
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:06): damn, wonder if ubnt emailed me back
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:06): titan is supposed to get some
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:06): and ubnt hasn't emailed me back yet
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:07): those things are as rare as bigfoot sightings
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:07): if I don't get an email back this time he can take his $160 bullshit card and stick it up his minipci sized ass.
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:07): tried calling them
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:07): no published #
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:07): ubnt is a novelty company
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:07): not a wisp equipment supplier
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:08): if they're trying to be a wisp equipment supplier they FUCKING SUCK AT THE JOB

a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:08): then again, the minute they decided to play the reseller game and bullshit the medium sized wisps wanting to order 100 packs, was the minute ubnt proved they're stupid.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:09): oh well, I think the problem is the SR9 is a 2.4 converter and nobody wants to admit it.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:09): (which would mean 2.4 crosstalk would affect the performance of the card)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:10): it'd greatly increase the expense of the device if you can't put an 11b/g radio alongside it.
776833c15e61c1feac12e570742b7258 (00:10): that would explain a lot
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:10): cpm: well, depends on what site you look at
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:10): a couple sr9 resellers straight out say "2.4 with onboard frequency converter", some say its ubnt's own custom radio chipset
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:10): logic (and price) say its a converter.
776833c15e61c1feac12e570742b7258 (00:10): that would explain the vast differences in performance folks are seeing with it.
776833c15e61c1feac12e570742b7258 (00:11): a 'few' folks have reported performance like we all hoped, most everyone else is , , disappointed
776833c15e61c1feac12e570742b7258 (00:11): from what I've read anyway
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:14): I mean.. some of us get 6-8 miles out of some old arlan crap, too.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:14): (lots of folks say these radios can't break 2 miles)
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:14): but...  arlans are a cheap experiment, being as they're like $25-or-less usually.
9a2c47ebaf5fdb05a80a325809046246 (00:28): guy is a -signal strength better than a +signal strength
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:30): porkpie: I do now know what you are talkngi about
9a2c47ebaf5fdb05a80a325809046246 (00:30): DRST:sorry
9a2c47ebaf5fdb05a80a325809046246 (00:31): DrDT:when I do a scan on my network I have -signal strength's and sometimes one of the units shows a +
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:32): that doesn't haelp much... which program you doing in this? what chipset on your cards? they report signal strenght different ways
9a2c47ebaf5fdb05a80a325809046246 (00:33): I am using winbox and the card is an Atheros AR5213
9a2c47ebaf5fdb05a80a325809046246 (00:33): It's running routerOS
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:34): ok, for Microtik I'm not sure aobu thte readings
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:34): but at least you gave us goo dinfo
9a2c47ebaf5fdb05a80a325809046246 (00:35): OK ...I think the higher the - number the better signal
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:37): ask for J4k3 or others who knowq microtik
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:42): porkpie: does it show as like +160?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:42): I occasionally see positive numbers in snooper mode
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (00:43): usually stuff skipping in from far far away
04f0ae20168af6458f51c69101cc193d (00:43): with wpa_supplicant -w -Dndiswrapper -iwlan0 -c/etc/wpa_supplicant.conf -w
04f0ae20168af6458f51c69101cc193d (00:43): I get Association request to the driver failed
04f0ae20168af6458f51c69101cc193d (00:43): Authentication with 00:00:00:00:00:00 timed out.
9a2c47ebaf5fdb05a80a325809046246 (00:46): J4K3:what the rule of thumb ...on the signal strength
9a2c47ebaf5fdb05a80a325809046246 (00:48): J4K3:is it the higher the -number the better the signal strength
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:09): porkpie: -50 is better than -60...
